results.title: Solo: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Phil Tucker
results.brief_description: Looks at how the film “Solo” was made, discussing some of the filming and climbing problems as well as the philosophy behind the film. Mike Hoover, the climber, talks about some of the stunts, and explains why he climbs mountains - the challenge, the dangers, problems and final gratification.

results.title: Solo whitewater
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Bill Mason
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Path of the Paddle”.
This film explains clearly how to locate a deep water channel by reading the rapids and how to apply the many paddling strokes and manoeuvres to steer the canoe where you want it to go. It also depicts what happens if you make a mistake and “wipe out” in a turbulent rapid, and how to survive the swim. (Award: Venissieux.)

results.title: Solo basic
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Bill Mason
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Path of the Paddle”.
The joy and poetry of paddling solo are illustrated in this film, as are all the basic strokes used in maintaining complete control of the canoe. With the aid of animated lines, the path of the paddle is clearly defined so there can be no mistaking what the paddle is doing. The use of the various strokes in rapids is demonstrated sufficiently to whet the appetite to move on.

results.title: Solo
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Mike Hoover
results.brief_description: Mike Hoover as the climber portrays the efforts and exhilarations that are experienced by the solo mountain climber. Filmed in Mexico, the United States and Canada on 21 different climbs this story explores the pleasures and dangers of mountain climbing by presenting three aspects of climbing of which the non-climber is rarely aware. These are the driving rhythm of sustained physical effort, the discovery of scenes and weathers unknown to others and the commitment to challenges which must be met alone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Mike Hoover

results.title: Solo
results.brief_description:
Vincent is a cello player and occasional drug dealer. On his way back to Paris he is informed that his brother Virgile is accused of criminal acts perpetrated on behalf of a group of revolutionary students. In a race against time, Vincent decides to get to his runaway brother before the police does.

Credits: Producer, Gilbert Marion ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Alain Moury, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Moustaki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Sylvie Breal, Anne Deleuze, Denis Le Guillou, Henri Poirier, R. J. Chauffard.

results.title: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton's laws of motion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Open University, Andrew Millington and Barrie Whatley
results.brief_description: Experimental evidence for Newton’s laws of motion is examined and a number of experiments are demonstrated to show the effect of forces on a massive concrete sphere. Illustrates concepts like kinetic and potential energy, compressional energy and the behaviour of matter in a force free environment
results.title_for_label: Solids, liquids and gases: Newton’s laws of motion (TEFC)

results.title: Solid, liquid, gas
results.brief_description: All materials, both living and nonliving, are matter. This video introduces students to the three forms of matter - solid, liquid and gas. Many common examples of each are given, as well as simple, effective demonstrations which help to describe their basic properties. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: Soleil Dans L'oeil = Sun in the Eyes (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Eric Schlumberger, Andre Deroual and Jacques Bourdon
results.brief_description:
Emma moves to Corsica to work on a translation. Every day she writes to Denis, her lover, who still lives in Paris. She becomes acquainted with Frederic, a local musician and finds herself torn between two lovers.

Credits: Producers, Eric Schlumberger, Andre Deroual ; director, Jacques Bourdon ; writers, Dominique Aury, Eric Schlumberger, Jacques Bourdon ; photography, Lucien Joulin ; music, Maurice Jarre
Cast: Anna Karina, Georges Descrieres, Jacques Perrin, Charles Blavette, Nadine Alari.

results.title: Soldiers in Sinai: a peacekeeping story
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Pierre des Bonnet
results.brief_description: A basic film on the setting up of a UN Emergency Force - men flown to the Sinai Desert on short notice to take up positions between two opposing lines, for the peace keeping operation that followed in the wake of 1973 war in the Middle East. Shows how troops from many nations learn to work together as a unique international peace force.
